Service Requests generally refer to something the user wants and/or needs but does not yet have. Many of these Service Requests are actually small changes – low risk, frequently occurring, low cost, etc. Examples of Service Requests include a request to grant access to CRM, to install an additional software application onto a particular workstation, to relocate an employee to another workplace or a request to reset a password. Their frequency and low risk nature means that Service Requests are more appropriately handled by a separate process, rather than being allowed to congest the Incident and Change Management processes. This separate process is the Request Fulfilment.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"The goal of the process is to fulfill Service Requests with standardized services, ensuring that its fulfillment is expedient, effective, and evaluated. In the workflow, a Service Request goes through several phases to complete the life cycle. Workflow phases can consist of one or multiple Tasks that must be completed to proceed to the next phase. The Service Request Coordinator can decline and reassign it back to the Service Desk for further categorization specifying the return reasons.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"The core of the Service Request fulfillment is creation and execution of related Tasks. All Tasks must be assigned to Operators of the Workgroup for processing. After all Tasks are fulfilled, the Service Request is to be validated whether it is resolved by the Service Request Coordinator. If no further actions required, the Service Request becomes resolved.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Requestors are notified after the Service Request is resolved. They can manually close their related Interaction by providing a feedback and rating the resolution. Otherwise, the system closes the Interaction automatically after a five-day period if there is no action taken from the Requestor. Finally, after the initial Interaction is closed, the linked Service Request becomes closed.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Service Requests are tracked from the beginning to the end to ensure compliance with the delivery time.
